Tree Series

February 2021

Montana began this series in December 2020. Each of these pieces in her tree series began as abstract paintings and slowly evolved into trees with mixed media techniques. She used collage, acrylic ink, spray paint, and acrylic paint pens on top of many layers of acrylic paint. The trees' sillouettes come from photos she took of trees in Wilder Ranch State Park in Santa Cruz, CA.

Beer Lover (2021)

acrylic, collage, and ink on canvas - 18x24"
now lives in Livermore, CA

Dog Mom (2021)

acrylic on canvas - 18x24"
now lives in Denver, CO

Little Brother (2021)

acrylic and ink on canvas - 12x12"
lives in Santa Cruz, CA

The Architect (2021)

acrylic, collage, and ink on canvas - 18x30"
now lives in Chicago, IL

The Astronaut (2021)

acrylic, collage, and ink on canvas - 18x24"
now lives in Denver, CO

The Good Soul (2021)

acrylic and acrylic pen on canvas - 12x12"
now lives in Chicago, IL

The Manager (2021)

acrylic, collage, and ink on canvas - 20x20"
lives in Santa Cruz, CA

The Middle Child (2021)

acrylic, collage, and ink on canvas - 16x20"
now lives in Chicago, IL

The Scholar (2021)

acrylic and ink on canvas - 16x20"
lost at sea

Not ready to pick a painting today? Curious about an inside look inside Montana's process? Montana shares the best updates in her newsletter, while giving daily updates on her Instagram (@montanafowler_cs_art). She loves connecting with others over their love for art.
